channel.title: Health news and tips - Screening Guide--Men

item.title: Men Ages 18-39: Protect Your Future
item.description:
Preventive screenings are medical tests that can detect illnesses before they become a serious health problem. Many diseases can be minimized or even prevented with routine screening.

Men Ages 18-39: Protect Your Future

  • Blood Pressure: starting at age 21, then at least every two years
  • Cholesterol: starting at age 20; ask your doctor
  • Sexually Transmitted Infection (STIs) test: both partners should get tested for STIs, before having sexual intercourse
  • Vision Exam once initially between age 20-29; twice between age 30-39
  • Dental Exam: one to two times every year
  • Tetanus-Diptheria Booster Vaccine: every 10 years

Talk to a doctor about what tests are best for you. Schedule an appointment today at pvhs.org/clinics.

item.title: Men Ages 40-49: Establish Healthy Habits
item.description:
Preventive screenings are medical tests that can detect illnesses before they become a serious health problem. Many diseases can be minimized or even prevented with routine screening.

Men Ages 40-49: Establish Healthy Habits

  • Blood Pressure: at least every two years
  • Cholesterol: ask your doctor
  • Blood Sugar Test: Starting at age 45, then every three years
  • Sexually Transmitted Infection (STIs) test: both partners should get tested for STIs, before having sexual intercourse
  • PSA for prostate cancer: ask your doctor
  • Vision Exam at age 40 and then every two to four years
  • Dental Exam: one to two times every year
  • Tetanus-Diptheria Booster Vaccine: every 10 years

Talk to a doctor about what tests are best for you. Schedule an appointment today at pvhs.org/clinics.

item.title: Men Ages 50-64: Make Health Improvements
item.description:
Preventive screenings are medical tests that can detect illnesses before they become a serious health problem. Many diseases can be minimized or even prevented with routine screening.

Men Ages 50-64: Make Health Improvements

  • Blood Pressure: at least every two years
  • Cholesterol: ask your doctor
  • Blood Sugar Test: every three years
  • Sexually Transmitted Infection (STIs) test: both partners should get tested for STIs, before having sexual intercourse
  • PSA for prostate cancer: ask your doctor
  • Vision Exam: every two to four years
  • Dental Exam: one to two times every year
  • Fecal Occult Blood Test: yearly
  • Colonoscopy: every 10 years
  • Tetanus-Diptheria Booster Vaccine: every 10 years

Talk to a doctor about what tests are best for you. Schedule an appointment today at pvhs.org/clinics.

item.title: Men Ages 65+: Maintain Your Health
item.description:
Preventive screenings are medical tests that can detect illnesses before they become a serious health problem. Many diseases can be minimized or even prevented with routine screening.

Men Ages 65+: Maintain Your Health

  • Blood Pressure: at least every two years
  • Cholesterol: ask your doctor
  • Blood Sugar Test: every three years
  • Sexually Transmitted Infection (STIs) test: both partners should get tested for STIs, before having sexual intercourse
  • Vision Exam: every one to two years
  • Dental Exam: one to two times every year
  • Fecal Occult Blood Test: yearly; older than age 75 ask your doctor
  • Colonoscopy: every 10 years; older than age 75, ask your doctor
  • Pneumococcal Vaccine: one time only
  • Tetanus-Diptheria Booster Vaccine: every 10 years

Talk to a doctor about what tests are best for you. Schedule an appointment today at pvhs.org/clinics.
